Clip.Title: SEIZING JUSTICE: THE GREENSBORO 4
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Actress and Activist Anna Deavere Smith celebrates the 50th Anniversary of the Desegregation of Greensboro Woolworth Lunch Counter.

Clip.Title: MLK: THE ASSASSINATION TAPES
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The story of the last days of Dr. Martin Luther King told through rare television and radio news accounts, many not seen or heard since 1968.

Clip.Title: THE CRADOCK MURDERS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: In June of 1985 in Cape Province, four anti-apartheid activists were ambushed and murdered. They became known as "the Cradock Four." See how their contributions paved helped pave the way for the of the racist Apartheid regime.

Clip.Title: BLACK WINGS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: From the barnstorming era through World War II and into the jet age, the worlds of aviation and race relations intersect in these fascinating stories of courage and innovation.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: From St. John's heading north, the Newfoundland coastline is a maze of iconic bays and inlets - from world-famous Fogo Island, to the abandoned fishing settlements along the island's Northern peninsula.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: From the remote Northern Shore of Nova Scotia, to the red mud perimetre of Prince Edward Island, the warm waters of the Northumberland Strait are the setting for an incredible aerial exploration of these coastlines.

Clip.Title: SERIOUSLY AMAZING OBJECTS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Lindbergh's Spirit of St. Louis, Irving Berlin's piano, and Seinfeld's puffy shirt. These are just some of the many items flown, touched, played, and worn by American icons, whose great success stories can be found at the Smithsonian. Join us as we give lucky museum goers a chance to get close to some Seriously Amazing Objects. Many of these treasures are locked deep in the vaults and are not always on public display...until now.

Clip.Title: MLK: THE ASSASSINATION TAPES
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The story of the last days of Dr. Martin Luther King told through rare television and radio news accounts, many not seen or heard since 1968.

Clip.Title: BARACK OBAMA: GREAT EXPECTATIONS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Go inside the White House and behind the scenes of Barack Obama's first term as President as he confronts major crises as well as Opposition determined to take him down.

Clip.Title: BARACK OBAMA: GREAT EXPECTATIONS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Go inside the White House and behind the scenes of Barack Obama's first term as President as he has confronts major crises as well as Opposition determined to take him down.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: From the highlands of the Americas to the world-famous tidal flats of the Bay of Fundy, this exploration of Nova Scotia reveals some of the world's best-kept secrets - here, on the edge of Canada.

Clip.Title: AERIAL AMERICA
Clip.EpisodeSummary: From its Great Lakes to its Grand Canyon, its Rocky Mountain peaks to its Key West reefs, America is a land of amazing destinations. This aerial adventure over the nation's most remarkable landscapes and landmarks captures the breathtaking beauty of America, while demonstrating how its sense of wonder has inspired countless artists, thinkers, and revolutionaries.

Clip.Title: AERIAL AMERICA
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Zoom above some of America's greatest landcapes and monuments in stunning HD realism.

Clip.Title: SPACE VOYAGES
Clip.EpisodeSummary: A mission to Mars may seem like the stuff of science fiction, but NASA is working to make it a reality. But one big question remains: can the human body withstand this 34-million-mile odyssey? See how modern science is preparing today's astronauts for our next adventures into the deadly void of outer space. The experiences of our first astronauts are helping engineers create new technology to overcome the biggest obstacle to long-term space travel: our human bodies.

Clip.Title: AERIAL AMERICA
